bio: Award-winning photographer & filmmaker. @dereckjoubert & I produce African wildlife conservation documentaries. More images at Natgeocreative.com

list.comment:
Excited about this. It’s a story that has taken a while to tell - but it’s an important story that the lions can tell like nobody else. #Repost @dereckjoubert ・・・
We’ve seen the destruction of wilderness. We’ve seen the effect of guns on an ecosystem. We’ve also seen that if you protect a landscape, it is possible for it return to its former glory. #BirthofaPride will show for US audiences on @natgeowild Dec 02. We will let you know when it is broadcast for other territories. #selindareserve #bigcatweek
An energetic game of hide and seek around a giant termite mound that offers so much in the way of entertainment. #littlebigcats #okavangolions #tsaropride

This is a bit far away but it shows how effective and determined this lioness is. She’s almost shoulder-deep in water and yet she’s still managed to catch an adult red lechwe - an antelope well-adapted to swampy conditions. #okavangolions #bigcats #swamplions #redlechwe

A pride destroyed. A pride reborn.
‘Birth of a Pride’ coming to @natgeowild soon. #birthofapride

Every muscle is defined and honed to perfection. She is in her prime and her daily hunting through the Okavango swamps has made her extraordinarily strong. When hunting with her pride, she'll have her set position - each lion keeping her same spot and responsibility and honing her part to perfection. Right now, she has small cubs to feed and is keeping them separate to the pride until they are big enough. Every day, she enters the swamps to hunt red lechwe - at times running through water for hours, and with her unrelenting determination she is highly successful. #OkavangoLions #TsaroPride #ThisIsMyTrophy #rippedmuch @ilcp_photographers

Hugely thankful for all the support that allows us to make a few positive changes. #Repost @dereckjoubert ・・・
This #Thanksgiving, we take a moment to reflect on a remarkable year made possible by you: our supporters, partners and friends of the Great Plains Foundation.
Together we achieved a remarkable milestone in #RhinosWithoutBorders, having saved a total of 87 rhinos from the cross-hairs of poachers by moving and releasing them to the expansive wilderness of Botswana, and witnessing the birth of 22 rhino calves. Together we instilled a sense of pride in the natural heritage of local young people in Kenya and Botswana. Together we watched as once skittish lions and elephants returned to the Sapi Reserve in Zimbabwe. Together we made an impact for conservation in Africa.
It is days like today that we take stock of the incredible journey a year can be and the accomplishments achieved through a shared vision. Thank you for sharing Great Plains’s vision for a brighter future for Africa’s wild places.
#conservation #goodnewsconservation #wildlife #rhinos

Needle-sharp little claws dig in to the hide of a patient mother. When lion cubs are not asleep or feeding, they're playing - behaviour that gradually teaches them the best way to stalk, pounce and catch; essentially how to become a successful predator. Anyone who has raised a kitten knows that when they are very young they haven't fully gained control over the amount of pressure they put into their claws and can often inadvertently puncture or scratch while they play. Lion cubs are just the same and @dereckjoubert and I often wince seeing them scrambling over one of the adults like an ice climber with pickaxes. The adults are remarkably patient with their young explorers but will shake them off or bat them with a restraining paw if the assault carries on for too long. #Okavangolions #TsaroPride #littlebigcats
Worn out from play and plenty of milk. #littlebigcats #okavangolions #snooze

Can nature ever be rebuilt? Brought back from near-extermination? Birth of a Pride. Coming soon! #birthofapride #bigcatweek @natgeowild @ilcp_photographers #Repost @dereckjoubert
・・・
Can nature ever be rebuilt? #BirthofaPride will be on US screens on December 2nd. Elsewhere in January next year. #bigcats #bigcatconservation #wildlife #nature #lions

A possible future king of Duba Plains. The Okavango is characterised by wide open plains of short grass interspersed with numerous termite mounds. These mounds are hugely important in this ecosystem. While termites play an important role in breaking down dead vegetation, their towering mounds provide homes to a number of animals - from warthogs to aardvarks. When termites emerge after the rains in millions - winging their way across the landscape, they feed many species of birds, reptiles and mammals - even sometimes lions. The mounds also supply important dry ground when the system floods, shade during the heat of the day and an excellent vantage point for predators to survey the landscape and plan their next hunt. This little lion has a long way to go until he takes down his first lechwe, but from a good vantage point he'll be able to watch his mother and aunts as they hunt - and he will learn. #littlebigcats #okavangolions #TsaroPride #DubaPlains

She’s done well as usual. It’s a brief little life for the young lechwe, but her two small cubs will gain strength and grow a bit more. Another step forward for them in this world where their odds are declining with rapidly shrinking ecosystems, increasing conflict with people, a growing shady demand for traditional medicines and people’s strange compunction to want to mount a lifeless head on a wall. #okavangolions #thisismytrophy #worthmorealive #circleoflife
